thread.title: Live updates: MSU looks to stay perfect against Indiana
thread.title_full: Live updates: MSU looks to stay perfect against Indiana

title: Live updates: MSU looks to stay perfect against Indiana
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Live updates: MSU vs. Indiana Follow the action here with updates throughout the game by Tony Garcia, special writer for The Detroit News. Post to Facebook Live updates: MSU vs. Indiana Follow the action here with updates throughout the game by Tony Garcia, special writer for The Detroit News.  //detne.ws/1LUEOV7   Join the Conversation To   Live updates: MSU vs. Indiana Tony Garcia, Special to The Detroit News 3:22 p.m. EDT October 24, 2015 Macgarrett Kings Jr. runs after a reception during MSU's win at Indiana last season. (Photo: Michael Hickey, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Spartans set to take on Hoosiers 
The No. 7 Michigan State Spartans (7-0, 3-0) are back at Spartan Stadium for the first time in three weeks to take on the Indiana Hoosiers (4-3, 0-3). 
The Hoosiers got off to a hot start, running through the nonconference season undefeated for the first time since 1990. However, Indiana has yet to find a win in the conference, losing their first three contests in Big Ten play. MSU, on the other hand, hasn't lost since Nov. 8, 2014, against Ohio State, and is coming off of an emotional high that is still hard to fully grasp a full week removed from the 27-23 victory over the Michigan Wolverines. 
MSU will be tested in the secondary more than in recent weeks, as the Hoosiers lead the Big Ten in total offense (478.9 yards per game), passing (284.0 yards per game), and third in points (34.1 per game). However, as prolific as their offense is, that is how porous their defense is. Indiana ranks 12th in rushing defense (170.0 yards per game) and 13th in passing defense (334.1 yards per game) which gives one reason to believe that Connor Cook will have a big day. 
Gerald Holmes will get the start at running back for Michigan State, as Madre London is not dressed for the contest. Jack Allen and Darian Hicks are not on the dress list as well. Read or Share this story: http://detne.ws/1LUEOV7 TOP VIDEOS
